beginner.question: What is the primary purpose of unit testing in a FullStack application?
options: To test the entire application as a whole
To test individual components or functions
To ensure the user interface is responsive
To check the application's deployment process
beginner.hint: Unit testing focuses on testing the smallest parts of an application.

beginner.question: Which tool is commonly used for end-to-end testing of web applications?
options: Jest
Mocha
Cypress
JUnit
beginner.hint: This tool is known for its ability to test web applications through a browser.

beginner.question: What is a test double in the context of software testing?
options: A duplicate test environment
A tool for running tests twice
An object used to mimic the behavior of real components
A method of testing two components simultaneously
beginner.hint: Test doubles are used to simulate the behavior of complex objects or components.

beginner.question: Why is integration testing important for API endpoints?
options: To test code formatting
To ensure different parts of the application work together
To check the application's speed
To test the user interface design
beginner.hint: Integration testing helps verify the interaction between different modules.

beginner.question: Which of the following is a benefit of mocking in testing?
options: It speeds up the test execution by replacing real objects with simplified versions
It ensures the application is ready for production
It makes the user interface more attractive
It improves the application's security
beginner.hint: Mocking helps in isolating the test environment by using fake objects.

intermediate.question: What is a key benefit of using mocking in unit testing backend services?
options: It improves the speed of tests by avoiding real HTTP requests.
It provides a user interface for simulating API calls.
It automatically generates code documentation.
It enhances the aesthetics of test reports.
intermediate.hint: Mocking is used to isolate the unit being tested.

intermediate.question: Which tool is commonly used for end-to-end testing of web applications and supports headless browser testing?
options: Mocha
Jest
Cypress
Sinon
intermediate.hint: This tool is known for its developer-friendly interface and real-time reloads.

intermediate.question: In integration testing, what is primarily tested?
options: Individual functions in isolation
Interactions between different modules or services
Code style and formatting
Compilation errors
intermediate.hint: This type of testing ensures that different parts of an application work together as expected.

intermediate.question: Which technology is NOT typically associated with testing full-stack applications?
options: React
Cypress
Jasmine
Docker
intermediate.hint: Think of a popular frontend library, not a testing tool.

intermediate.question: What is a common use case for test doubles in testing?
options: To replace slow or unavailable components during tests
To generate real-time production data
To automate deployment processes
To optimize database queries
intermediate.hint: Test doubles are substitutes for real objects that are impractical to incorporate into tests.

advanced.question: Which of the following is the primary advantage of using test doubles in unit testing?
options: They allow testing in isolation without dependencies.
They improve the performance of the actual code.
They enhance the readability of the test code.
They automatically generate code documentation.
advanced.hint: Test doubles help simulate components that are not part of the test.

advanced.question: In the context of integration testing, what is the main goal when testing API endpoints?
options: To ensure the code is optimized for performance.
To verify the interaction between different parts of the system.
To check the user interface response time.
To validate the deployment process.
advanced.hint: Integration testing focuses on the interaction between components.

advanced.question: When using Cypress for end-to-end testing, which of the following is a key feature?
options: Server-side rendering testing.
Real-time reloading during test development.
Automated code refactoring.
Database schema validation.
advanced.hint: Cypress is known for its developer-friendly environment.

advanced.question: What is the primary purpose of mocking in backend unit tests?
options: To replace a function with a less resource-intensive version.
To ensure code is executed in strict sequence.
To simulate external dependencies for isolation.
To verify database transaction efficiency.
advanced.hint: Mocking helps isolate the unit under test by simulating dependencies.

advanced.question: In end-to-end testing, which tool is better suited for testing complex user interactions, and why?
options: Jest, because it is fast and minimalistic.
Mocha, because it supports asynchronous testing.
Cypress, because it operates directly in the browser.
Karma, because it integrates with most CI tools.
advanced.hint: Consider the tool's ability to interact with the browser environment.
